intro: Oxyspora auriculata, commonly known as the ear-shaped spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, ear-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in complex inflorescences called cyathia. Oxyspora auriculata is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories. It is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage.
